edu.ucdavis.cstars.client

Class UndoManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.UndoManager

  • public class UndoManager
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    The Undo Manager is a utility object that allows you to easily build applications with undo/redo functionality. Use the Undo Manager to add operations (edits, navigation changes, graphics drawing) to the stack. The API includes a set of edit operations (add,delete,update, cut and union), created by inherting from the OperationBase class. You can inherit from the OperationBase class to create custom operations that take advantage of undo/redo.
    Author:
    Justin Merz

        public final int getLength()

        Returns:
        int

      • position

        public final int position()
        The current operation position. A position value of 0 means that no operations are available on the stack. When an undo operation is performed the position decreases by 1. When a redo occurs the position is incremented by 1.
        Returns:
        int

      • add
